intro: Zexmenia trachylepis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed zexmenia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant features slender, hairy stems and pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges. Its small white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbrella-like structures, typical of the carrot family. Zexmenia trachylepis is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and distinctive foliage.
